details.title: The Word Storage Relay (WSR)
details.abstract: One of the more complex systems developed during the cold war was the BOMARC missile system developed by Boeing and the University of Michigan. The BO in the acronym stands for Boeing and the MARC Stands for Michigan Aeronautical Research Center. Boeing built two versions of the BOMARC, the first one designated “IM99A” and the second “IM99B”. The “A” version used a liquid propellant boost system with a range of about 250 miles and the “B” used a solid propellant for boost and had a range of at least 400 miles. The BOMARC was a pilotless aircraft vehicle, developed and deployed to counter the Soviet massed bomber threat
details.journal_title: IEEE Aerospace and Electronic Systems Magazine
